title: Tennis-Goerges and Bertens advance to Charleston final
text:
April 8, 2018 / 7:55 PM / Updated 19 minutes ago Tennis-Goerges and Bertens advance to Charleston final Reuters Staff 2 Min Read 
April 8 (Reuters) - Germany’s Julia Goerges and Dutch 12th seed Kiki Bertens advanced to the final of the rain-delayed Volvo Car Open with semi-final victories on Sunday. 
They will meet for the title later on Sunday in Charleston, South Carolina. 
The fifth-seeded Goerges defeated eighth seed Anastasija Sevastova, of Latvia, 7-6(5) 6-3 after the match had been suspended on Saturday with the score 4-4 in the first set. 
Bertens outlasted American Madison Keys 6-4 6-7(2) 7-6(5) in the other, much tighter semi-final. 
World number 13 Goerges, who broke into the top 10 for the first time earlier in the year, will be seeking her second title of 2018 after winning in Auckland in January. 
When her match resumed, the German took the first set in a tiebreak before going on to reach her seventh final in the past 12 months. 
Goerges hit 45 winners, almost twice as many as Sevastova’s 23 but the Latvian still had her chances, only managing to convert one of 14 break points. 
Bertens, going for her first win this year, broke Keys eight times and saved a match point in their morning semi-final. 
Keys led 5-4 in the third set before the Dutch player rallied to force the deciding tiebreak, which she won when Keys netted a backhand. (Reporting by Gene Cherry in Salvo, North Carolina, editing by Ian Chadband)
